title: Mercury retrograde (general)
summary: A review-oriented communication cycle that exposes weak systems, unclear agreements, and outdated assumptions. The emphasis is on revision, retrieval, and recalibration—not disruption for its own sake.

meaning.headline: This cycle favors revision over acceleration.

frames.text: Mercury retrograde shifts attention from forward momentum to inspection: what’s unfinished, miscommunicated, or poorly designed becomes visible.
Issues that surface now are rarely new—they’re reminders of things that were skipped, rushed, or assumed.
Delays and reversals often function as correction mechanisms, not failures.
Past conversations, projects, or decisions may resurface asking for a second pass.
Everything will break during Mercury retrograde.

frictions: Technical or logistical issues revealing fragile systems
Reopening conversations people assumed were closed
Mental loops driven by incomplete information
opportunities: Repairing systems before they scale further
Editing, revising, or refactoring existing work
Recovering lost ideas, contacts, or context
Building redundancy and resilience into plans

do: Treat confusion as a design flaw to fix, not a personal failure.
Revisit past work with fresh eyes and better constraints.
Document decisions and agreements in writing.
Allow extra buffer time for communication and logistics.
avoid: Rushing launches that depend on fragile systems
Assuming others have the same context you do
Ignoring small errors because they feel inconvenient
Interpreting delays as bad luck or sabotage

reusable_lines.text: Mercury retrograde doesn’t stop progress—it asks for a better draft.
Slowdowns now often prevent bigger problems later.

forbidden_claims: Advising against all decisions or commitments
Attributing unrelated problems solely to Mercury retrograde
allowed_framing: Agency-forward framing: 'you can use this period to…'

sources: Mercury retrograde as review/revision cycle archetype
